passages.text:
Your parents left town for the weekend.
Since you're the oldest (17) they left you in charge. 
Your siblings are 6 and 3.

What gender is the 6-year-old?
(Heavily simplified genders to make the passage number smaller, doesn't reflect my own views.)

Boy
Girl
passages.name: Home

passages.text:
You chose Boy. 
What gender is the 3-year-old?
(Heavily simplified genders to make the passage number smaller, doesn't reflect my own views.)

Boy
Girl
passages.name: 6yo Boy

passages.text:
You chose Girl. 
What gender is the 3-year-old?
(Heavily simplified genders to make the passage number smaller, doesn't reflect my own views.)

Girl
Boy
passages.name: 6yo Girl

passages.text:
You chose Boy. 
So you have 2 younger brothers.

To pass the time you recommend watching TV. 
Your youngest brother is playing with a toy car. 

Turn on TV
passages.name: 3yo Boy Boy

passages.text:
You chose Girl. 
So you have a middle brother and a younger sister. 

To pass the time you recommend watching TV. 
Your younger sister is playing with a toy car. 

Turn on TV
passages.name: 3yo Girl Boy

passages.text:
You chose Girl. 
So you have two younger sisters.

To pass the time you recommend watching TV. 
Your youngest sister is playing with a toy car. 

Turn on TV
passages.name: 3yo Girl Girl

passages.text:
You chose Boy. 
So you have a middle sister, and a younger brother.

To pass the time you recommend watching TV. 
Your youngest brother is playing with a toy car. 

Turn on TV
passages.name: 3yo Boy Girl

passages.text:
You turn on the TV and sit down. Hopefully tonight goes quickly. 

Your brothers start fighting over the toy car. 
Do you want to tell them to be quiet or give them another car?

Stop fighting
Another Car
passages.name: TV1

passages.text:
You turn on the TV and sit down. Hopefully tonight goes quickly. 

While watching the TV, you don't notice your brother finds Dad's lighter.
He catches the curtains and starts screaming.

What do you do?

Panic
Grab Water
passages.name: TV2

passages.text:
You turn on the TV and sit down. Hopefully tonight goes quickly.

You don't notice your sister go to you parents bathroom where she finds Mom's curling iron.
It was left on.
She comes in running and crying. 

What do you do?

Panic
Go Investigate
passages.name: TV3

passages.text:
You turn on the TV and sit down. Hopefully tonight goes quickly. 

Your sisters start fighting over the toy car. 
Do you want to tell them to be quiet or give them another car?

Stop Arguing
Another car
passages.name: TV4

passages.text:
Suddenly, the car goes through the air and knocks the TV of the entertainment center. 
The TV breaks. Mom and Dad are going to be mad.

Should you try and hide the TV and hope they don't notice, or call them?

Call Them
Hide
passages.name: Broken TV

passages.text:
Mom and Dad come home. Tonight was easier than expected.

 You're NOT grounded.
passages.name: TV fine

passages.text:
Mom answers the phone and immediately starts yelling. 
You should have gave them the extra car. 

You're grounded.
passages.name: Yelling

passages.text:
You throw a blanket over the TV and pretend to read. 
Shortly after your parents pull in the driveway. Immediately they start yelling. 
You should have gave them the extra car. 

You're grounded.
passages.name: Blanket

passages.text:
Quickly fire ensues. 
You grab your siblings and run outside. 
A neighbor calls the Fire Department and then your parents come home. 
Now you're grounded for not paying attention, but they're happy you're safe. 

You're grounded.
passages.name: Fire

passages.text:
You pull the curtains onto the floor and start throwing water on them to put out the fire. 
Mom and Dad pull in the driveway. 
They see the singed curtains on the floor. 
To your surprise they say they're happy you caught it in time and you're not grounded.

You're NOT grounded.
passages.name: Water

passages.text:
You notice the counter is starting to warp around the curling iron. 
There's smoke coming off a towel that hangs on the wall. 

What do you do?

Panic
Grab Water
passages.name: Melted Sink

passages.text:
You unplug the curling iron. 
You put the towel that was smoking into the sink and run water on it just to be safe. 
Mom and Dad come home. 
They ask what happened and you tell them your sister found the curling iron on and you took care of it. 
Other than a melted counter top, no one was hurt. 

You're NOT grounded.
passages.name: Water2
